intro: Adenocarpus divaricatus var. graecus, commonly known as the Greek sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its small, yellow flowers appear in clusters and are followed by elongated, ribbed seed pods. The species is known for its hardy nature and is often found in coastal and inland areas across southern Europe.
